intro: Quamoclit cholulensis, commonly known as the Cholulense Quamoclit, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from red to orange. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
